bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Etiological Agent. Pathological Mechanism identical with qi ni 氣逆 , qi counterflow. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 14: 邪動則氣 奔逆上，氣上則五臟傷動 , “Excited by evil [qi], the [regular] qi runs and ascends contrary to its regular direction. When the qi ascends, the five depots are harmed”.

② Pathological Condition with an unbearable itch, which does not end despite scratching that draws blood. Chuan xin shi yong fang Recipe book. Southern Song era, 1180. 傳信適用方 Last juan quoting Zhi qi ji fang 治奇疾方 : 遍身忽皮底混混如波浪聲，癢不可忍，抓之 肉血出，亦不能解，為之氣奔 , “Suddenly there is a movement, like a wave in the sea, at the base of the skin all over the body. The itch is unbearable. If scratched, blood leaves the flesh, but this fails to resolve [the itch]. This is ‘ qi run ’”.
